titles.title: To amend the Reclamation Wastewater and Groundwater Study and Facilities Act to authorize the Secretary of the Interior to participate in the design, planning, and construction of a project to reclaim and reuse wastewater within and outside of the service area of the City of Austin Water and Wastewater Utility, Texas.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Water and Power.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Subcommittee on Water and Power Discharged.
Reported by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 107-635.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 384.

term.name: Federal aid to water resources development

bill.summary: 9/4/2002--Reported to House without amendment. Amends the Reclamation Wastewater and Groundwater Study and Facilities Act to authorize the Secretary of the Interior to participate in the planning (including an appraisal and feasibility study), design, and construction of, and land acquisition for, a project to reclaim and reuse wastewater within and outside of the service area of the City of Austin Water and Wastewater Utility, Texas.Limits the Federal share to 25 percent of total project costs.Prohibits the Secretary from providing funds for project operation and maintenance.
